title: Remainder Theorem Definition
text: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by $$(x-a)$$, then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in $$x=-3$$ into our dividend.
speech: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by  times, parentheses x minus a,  , then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in  x is equal to negative 3  into our dividend.
pacedSpeech: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by   times,  x minus a,
, then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in   x is equal to negative 3

title: Plugging In
text: $$3x^3-2x^2+x-4$$ becomes 3(-3)**3-2(-3)**2+(-3)-4 after plugging in. This simplifies to $$-106$$.
speech: 3 x cubed, minus 2 x squared, plus x minus 4  becomes 3(-3)**3-2(-3)**2+(-3)-4 after plugging in. This simplifies to  negative 106 .
pacedSpeech: 3 x cubed, minus 2 x squared, plus x minus 4
becomes 3(-3)**3-2(-3)**2+(-3)-4 after plugging in. This simplifies to   negative 106
